page.title: 02Briquette Making In Glossop
page.content: At{Union Carbide}in{Old Glossop} they make{briquettes}for use in smelting special alloy steels. They begin by putting the raw materials through a crusher which reduces any lumps to a powder. Workers are always on watch to make sure wrong materials are not mixed. Next the powder is mixed with cement and limestone to harden the{ {briquettes.}The machine which does this process can make nine{briquettes} in six seconds. The men work in 12 hour shifts and the machines are rarely idle. The{briquettes}are loaded onto pallets and wrapped in polythene.{ {Union Carbide}have been making briquettes since 1950. A wide range is made including ferro-silicon, ferro-manganese, silicon-carbide and ferro-chrome.
